article:
Mrs. Evans was home from work. She had just gone into the kitchen to make the afternoon tea _ she saw a mouse running around on the kitchen floor. She _ and jumped up on the table. As soon as the mouse had gone, she jumped off from the _ , rushed out of the kitchen, put on her coat, ran out of the house and got on a bus which was going into the town. There she hurried into a shop and _ a large mouse-trap  . She wanted to put an end to this mouse as quickly as possible.
When she got home _ the trap, she realized that she had forgotten to buy any cheese to put in it. She searched everywhere _ there was not any in the house. It was too late to buy any because now all the shops were _ . She wondered what to do. In the end ,  she had a clever idea. She took a pair of scissors and cut a picture of a piece of cheese out of a magazine. Then she put the picture in the trap instead of a piece of cheese.
The next _ , Mrs. Evans came down to the cooking room and went straight away to the place where she had put the trap. She wanted to see if her plan had _ .The picture of the cheese had gone and in its place was a picture of a mouse.
